main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Anchorage, Alaska in 1952 and 1953, involving bright lights and round objects emitting a reddish glow.
interesting points: The civilian witness described the objects as moving in a westerly direction and emitting a reddish glow.
One of the objects was reported to be approximately 25 miles long and about the same size as a football, hovering approximately 35 feet above the horizon.
Another object was sighted on a day with 20 miles visibility, and the visibility was confirmed by two other persons.
The investigating officer suggested the possibility that the observed source could have been the planet Jupiter, which appears very bright in the approximate position of the observed light.
The report was downgraded at 3 year intervals and declassified after 12 years, indicating ongoing monitoring and investigation by the authorities.
sighted object: bright lights and round objects emitting a reddish glow
